chargeHist.descr: Battery to Law Enforcement Officers, Fire Fighters or Commission Wardens

result.execSummary:
The defendant Marchello J Vasquez was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Marchello J Vasquez in court with attorney John j Forrestal.  Defendant Marchello J Vasquez in custody.  Ronald Dague appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant changes plea to GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights. Plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the amended information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  Court advised the defendant that as a convicted felon he may no longer use or possess any firearms; also he may not vote in any election until his civil rights have been restored.  Court further advised that if he is not a US citizen, deportation is possible.  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements made by State, Defense and Defendant.  

AS TO COUNT 1:
The Court sentenced defendant to serve 6  MONTHS in the House of Corrections, concurrent to sentence defendant is serving in the State of California, with credit for 30 days time served.  

-Court ordered defendant pay Court costs, including extradition fee of $1,457.46 payable to the Milwaukee County District Attorney' Office, and all applicable surcharges and assessments forthwith; nonpayment penalty shall result in a civil judgment
-Defendant is to provide a DNA sample and pay the related surcharge forthwith; nonpayment penalty shall result in a civil judgment

AS TO COUNT 2:
The Court sentenced defendant to serve 6 MONTHS in the House of Corrections, concurrent to sentence defendant is serving in the State of California, with credit for 30 days time served.

-Court ordered defendant pay Court costs and all applicable surcharges and assessments forthwith; nonpayment penalty shall result in a civil judgment
-Court waived DNA sample and payment of the related surcharges forthwith; non payment penalty shall result in a civil judgment

Defendant Marchello J Vasquez in court with attorney John j Forrestal.  Defendant Marchello J Vasquez in custody.  Ronald Dague appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Original Amended Information received and filed.  Defense acknowledges receipt of the amended Information, waives reading and enters a plea of not guilty on behalf of his client.  COUNT 1 amended to:  Misdemeanor Battery pursuant to Wisc. Stats. Sec. 940.19(1), a Class A Misdemeanor.

Attorney John j Forrestal in court, defendant Marchello J Vasquez not in court, in custody.  Ronald Dague appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Scheduling conference held between counsel.  Parties engaged in settlement negotiations.  Defense requests date for possible resolution of this matter.  Matter set for plea/sentencing.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for November 3, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Marchello J Vasquez in court with attorney John j Forrestal.  Defendant Marchello J Vasquez in custody. Katherine Seelow for Ronald Dague appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed.  Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Witkowiak, Branch 22.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant plead not guilty.  Scheduling conference scheduled for November 2, 2016 at 08:30 am.
-Court ordered all previous conditions to remain the same.

Deputy Court Clerk: TC. Arguments heard as to bail. Court amends cash bail. Court ordered case adjourned for Preliminary Hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 20, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
